meanings.sent1: The teacher reimposed the rule after the students broke it.
meanings.sent2: The government reimposed the tax on sugary drinks.
meanings.sent3: The magician reimposed the disappearing act for the third time, much to the audience's delight.
meanings.sent4: She reimposed her authority over the unruly class with a stern look.
meanings.sent5: The chef reimposed the ban on using cell phones in the kitchen to ensure focus and safety.

meanings.sent1: The librarian reimposed the fine for late book returns.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to reimpose the parking restrictions in the busy area.
meanings.sent3: The park ranger reimposed the ban on feeding the ducks, causing a commotion among the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The king reimposed the ancient law, bringing back order to the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The coach reimposed the strict training regimen to prepare the team for the upcoming championship.

meanings.sent1: The company reimposed the dress code policy for all employees.
meanings.sent2: The school board decided to reimpose the ban on electronic devices in classrooms.
meanings.sent3: The mayor reimposed the curfew, much to the dismay of the late-night crowd.
meanings.sent4: The judge reimposed the restraining order to ensure the safety of the plaintiff.
meanings.sent5: The manager reimposed the weekly meetings to improve communication within the team.
